name: acknowledgements
desc: Any acklowdgements for this variable

name: coding
desc: This is an optional internal field that describes in details the measurement

name: dataset_id
desc: dataset id  e.g. APSL1AD. This should just be the name of the folder on the UHC server (minus the date appendix)

name: dataset_instance
desc: concatenation of  | {dataset_id}_{version} | ; usefule intermediate variable that currently is a required composite key (this requirement may be relax).

name: dataset_notes
desc: Any additional information can be added here. For example some dataset or file specific notes could be added here.

name: dataset_version
desc: version of the data point. This use to be just version  but we we udpate to sp

name: day
desc: Day as string

name: domain
desc: Highest level of variable categorization. A list of these can be found at https://data.lacurbanhealth.org/data/about.

name: estimate_type
desc: This is a internal utility variable that determines if a data point is an estimate, iteration, actual value … etc. Need better docemntaiton here with OBT EDA.

name: file_codebook
desc: File name of the codebook file used for this dataset

name: file_data
desc: File where data came from. Note that this is only found in the data and not codebooks, so lets keep it as a data attribute that every data point will have.

name: geo
desc: What geographic level the observation is at (L1, L2 … etc). Note this is a required variable for area level data but should be empty for all other observation types.

name: has_confidence_interval
desc: Utility indicator that is true for values with CI and false when only point data is available.

name: iso2
desc: lower case ISO2 country code.

name: limitations
desc: Place to describe any limitaitons for this variable.

name: longitudinal
desc: Is this variable qualified for longitudinal analysis or visualizations?

name: month
desc: Month as numeric string (1-12)

name: observation_id
desc: Unique SALURBAL Observation identifier

name: observation_type
desc: Category of SALURBAL Observation Type

name: public
desc: Categorical indicator for whether accessibility status for this data point (e.g. public, private … various shades of grey).

name: schema_version
desc: This denotes what version of the schema the dataset was renovated to. Note that v1 will be completely missing this as we did not account for this. So the earlist is the v2 schema which is details in the v2 release notes of SLAURBAL ETL repository.

name: source
desc: Data source

name: source_URL
desc: URL Associated with the data source

name: source_terms_of_use_URL
desc: The terms of use of the origin data source.

name: strata_1_name
desc: The name of the the first population strata (e.g. Sex).

name: strata_1_raw
desc: The raw value of the first population strata for the specific data point. (e.g. "1" or "0")

name: strata_1_value
desc: Recoding of the raw strata_1_raw into a human-readable value (e.g., "Male" or  "Female")

name: strata_2_name
desc: The name of the the second population strata (e.g. Standard population).

name: strata_2_raw
desc: The raw value of the second population strata for the specific data point. (e.g. "City"  )

name: strata_2_value
desc: Recoding of the raw strata_1_raw into a human-readable value (e.g. "City specific")

name: strata_description
desc: This should describe in detail what strata are available for this variable. Please include details about each strata if applicable.

name: strata_id
desc: Unique identifier for strata within a variable.

name: subdomain
desc: Lower level of variable categorization. A list of these can be found at https://data.lacurbanhealth.org/data/about.

name: tags
desc: An optional metadata field that can used as a flexible tag that exists outside the normal domain/subdomain structure. This came from tags raw ‘Domains’ in the health survey records dataset. It should just be a semicolan seperate string for now.

name: time_resolution_type
desc: Represents the scale of time for this data point.

name: units
desc: This is the short label to be appended to the data value. It will be used for annotating text or visualizations with a unit label (e.g. cases per 100k).

name: value
desc: Value for this particular data point.

name: value_iteration
desc: This is an attribute associated with sampled data (think model predictions or simiulations that have many iterations).

name: value_lci
desc: This is the Lower Confidence Interval (LCI) for the associated variable. The LCI representing the lower limit of the confidence range for the primary 'value'. This value indicates the lowest possible accurate value within the confidence range, considering statistical uncertainty.

name: value_type
desc: What type of data is the value.

name: value_uci
desc: This is the Upper Confidence Interval (UCI) for the associated variable.The UCI indicates the upper limit of the confidence range for the primary 'value'. This estimate provides an understanding of the statistical uncertainty surrounding the primary value, suggesting the highest possible accurate value.

name: var_def
desc: Details definition of what the variable is about. If categorical include coding here.

name: var_label
desc: Short human readable variable label.

name: var_name
desc: SALURBAL system harmonized variable name.

name: var_name_raw
desc: Original variable name in the source or pre-renovated SALURBAL dataset.

name: variable_origin
desc: A list of SALURBAL var_name used to operationalize this variable.

name: year
desc: Year of the particular observation. This could be a single year or a range; we have an intermediate variable  | time_resolution_type |  which is a categorization of the type of value  | year |  is.
